cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi WSW of Negril, Jamaica and about 130 mi SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, crossing western Cuba Friday, then turning north over the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (LA–MS) where significant strengthening is forecast
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system not forecast to track offshore of Boston, MA within the 5-day window)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches expected later for portions of the northern Gulf Coast — none for New England
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for Cayman Islands and western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Cayman Islands, northern U.S. Gulf Coast (LA–MS-AL)
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: 2021-09-02 (remnant low expected to pass well west or south of New England after day-5 period)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed for Boston, MA in Advisory #1 wind-probability table
weather_observation.first_hazard: None (Port lies far outside influence of IDA through forecast period)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at Boston, MA during the next 5 days
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for Boston, MA from IDA
weather_observation.rainfall: No heavy rainfall expected at Boston, MA in the 5-day outlook
